channel.title: Os X on Biboroku
channel.description: Recent content in Os X on Biboroku

item.title: Installing ATLAS on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.description: Installing from Fink Do: $ fink install atlas atlas-shlibs That’s it. They will be installed under /sw/lib. Installing from Source (Recommended if Building Other Software That Depends on ATLAS) First of all, I need a FORTRAN compiler, so install it.

item.title: Installing GFortran on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.description: Installing from GFortran Wiki (My Current Preferred Way) GCC Wiki has a link to Mac OS X installer. As the command gfortran will be installed at /usr/local/gfortran and causes less interference with other libraries and software, this is my preferred way.

item.title: Installing SExtractor on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.description: (November 25, 2010) I screwed up SExtractor installation for no reason and in an attempt to fix it, I’ve found a few things. After wasting a few hours again, I think this installation note can work for most people who can actually build software from source… I think the usefulness of this note will be limited though, as a new release of SExtractor appears imminent.

item.title: Installing Squid Proxy Server on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.description: My goal is to set up a very basic proxy server on my Mac box on campus, so that I can have full access to subscription-based academic journals via the proxy on my laptop even when I am off campus.

item.title: Installing FFTW on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.description: No FORTRAN compiler appears to be included in Xcode, so I need to install it if I haven’t done so. I installed GFortran. In the configure statement below, set F77 to gfortran. Installing from Fink For FFTW version 3.x, do:

item.title: Installing HOTPANTS 5.1.10 on Mac OS X Leopard
item.description: You must love the name, but what the software does is far from sultry; it’s a piece of geekware. Anyways, I needed to edit files when I install HOTPANTS, photometric alignment utility by Andrew Becker. Here is my installation note before I forget.

item.title: Setting Up Squid Proxy Server on Mac OS X Leopard
item.description: My goal is to set up a very basic proxy server on my Mac box on campus, so that I can have full access to subscription-based academic journals via the proxy on my laptop even when I am off campus.
